result.execSummary:
The defendant Michelle M Hayes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's probation revoked - sentenced to county jail/hoc on 5-26-17; unpaid court obligations of $886 and supervision fees of $160

Cases called: 15CF444 & 15CF259, Defendant Michelle M Hayes in court, in custody with attorney Tristan F Eagon.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have received and reviewed revocation paperwork. Sentencing statements. In 15CF259, Court sentenced defendant to 6 months jail on count 2 and 90 days jail on count 3, concurrent with each other. Huber privileges granted pursuant to jail rules, includes treatment. Civil judgment for unpaid court-ordered financials.  In 15CF444, to 3 months jail, consecutive to 15CF259. Huber privileges granted pursuant to jail rules, includes treatment. Civil judgment for unpaid court-ordered financials. Court granted 135 days jail credit in 15CF259 and 31 days in 15CF444 for time served.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 26, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

cases called: 15CF259 & 15CF444, Defendant Michelle M Hayes in court with attorney Leonie Dolch.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count 2 in 15CF444 and cts. 2&3 in 15CF259. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence: 2 yr. probation in each case, $443 in 15CF444, court costs of $543, $343 in 15CF259. 20 days conditional jail on the battery commencing 2/28/16 at 7 p.m. Huber granted under jail rules. Conditions of both cases:  Maintain absolute sobriety with exception of prescribed medicine. Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. Submit DNA sample. All other cts. in both cases read in and dismissed. Jail credit - 1 day in 15CF259.
